trans-unit.source: Prompts the user to choose a font from among those installed on the local computer.
The inherited member <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.ShowDialog%2A> must be invoked to create this specific common dialog box.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.HookProc%2A> can be overridden to implement specific dialog box hook functionality.
When you create an instance of FontDialog, some of the read/write properties are set to initial values.
For a list of these values, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog"></xref> class.
When you create an instance of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog>, the following read/write properties are initialized.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.AllowSimulations%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.AllowVectorFonts%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.AllowVerticalFonts%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.AllowScriptChange%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.Color%2A>|`Color.Black`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.FixedPitchOnly%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MaxSize%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MinSize%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.ScriptsOnly%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.ShowApply%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.ShowColor%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.ShowEffects%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.ShowHelp%2A>|`false`| You can change the value for any of these properties through a separate call to the property.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can change the character set specified in the **Script** combo box to display a character set other than the one currently displayed.
The **Script** combo box found on the **Font** dialog box contains character sets associated with the selected font.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the user can change the character set specified in the **Script** combo box; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows graphics device interface (GDI) font simulations.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if font simulations are allowed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows vector font selections.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if vector fonts are allowed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays both vertical and horizontal fonts or only horizontal fonts.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if both vertical and horizontal fonts are allowed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the user clicks the **Apply** button in the font dialog box.
Every time the **Apply** button is clicked, another Apply event is raised.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To be added.
Gets or sets the selected font color.
The color of the selected font.
The default value is <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Black*>.
Owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.Apply"></xref> event.
To be added.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows only the selection of fixed-pitch fonts.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if only fixed-pitch fonts can be selected; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the selected font.
The selected font.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box specifies an error condition if the user attempts to select a font or style that does not exist.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the dialog box specifies an error condition when the user tries to select a font or style that does not exist; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Specifies the common dialog box hook procedure that is overridden to add specific functionality to a common dialog box.
A hook procedure is a mechanism by which a function can intercept events before they reach an application.

When you override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.HookProc%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog> class, the operating system invokes your override of the function to post operating system messages to the window.
The handle to the dialog box window.
The message being received.
Additional information about the message.
Additional information about the message.
A zero value if the default dialog box procedure processes the message; a nonzero value if the default dialog box procedure ignores the message.
Gets or sets the maximum point size a user can select.
In order for the maximum and minimum size settings to take effect, MaxSize must be greater than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MinSize%2A>, and both must be greater than 0.
Attempts to set this property to values less than 0 will result in a value of 0 being used.
If you set MaxSize to a value less than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MinSize%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MinSize%2A> is set to MaxSize.
The effect of setting <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MinSize%2A> and MaxSize to the same values is to limit the size selection to a single font size.
When the point size is 0, there are no font size limits.
The maximum point size a user can select.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the minimum point size a user can select.
In order for the maximum and minimum size settings to take effect, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MaxSize%2A> must be greater than MinSize, and both must be greater than 0.
Attempts to set this property to values less than 0 will result in a value of 0 being used.
If you set MinSize to a value greater than <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MaxSize%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MaxSize%2A> is set to the value of MinSize.
The effect of setting MinSize and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.MaxSize%2A> to the same value is to limit the size selection to a single font size.
When the point size is 0, there are no font size limits.
The minimum point size a user can select.
The default is 0.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog.Apply"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For an overview, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the data.
Gets values to initialize the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog"></xref>.
The Options property corresponds to the flags used to initialize a color dialog box using Win32.
Use the properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog> class to get and set the options.
A bitwise combination of internal values that initializes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FontDialog"></xref>.
Resets all dialog box options to their default values.
When the options are reset, the strikethrough, underline, and color effects are enabled.
The fonts listed include only the screen fonts supported by the system.
Specifies a file dialog box.
The RunDialog method is invoked when the user of a font dialog box calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.ShowDialog%2A> method.
The window handle of the owner window for the common dialog box.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the dialog box was successfully run; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box allows selection of fonts for all non-OEM and Symbol character sets, as well as the ANSI character set.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if selection of fonts for all non-OEM and Symbol character sets, as well as the ANSI character set, is allowed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box contains an **Apply** button.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the dialog box contains an **Apply** button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays the color choice.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the dialog box displays the color choice; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box contains controls that allow the user to specify strikethrough, underline, and text color options.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the dialog box contains controls to set strikethrough, underline, and text color options; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the dialog box displays a Help button.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the dialog box displays a Help button; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Retrieves a string that includes the name of the current font selected in the dialog box.
A string that includes the name of the currently selected font.
